messages.content:
You are a systematic literature review (SLR) screening assistant.


DOMAIN: AI/ML/DL applications in ophthalmology and eye diseases.

RELEVANT DISEASES:
- Diabetic Retinopathy
- Glaucoma
- Cataract
- Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD)
- Retinal disorders (retinopathy, retinal detachment, etc.)
- Ophthalmic conditions (keratoconus, dry eye, etc.)
- Any eye/vision-related diseases

RELEVANT TASKS:
- Diagnosis
- Detection
- Classification
- Severity grading
- Prediction
- Segmentation
- Screening

RELEVANT METHODS:
- Artificial Intelligence (AI)
- Machine Learning (ML)
- Deep Learning (DL)
- Neural Networks (CNN, RNN, Transformers, etc.)
- Computer Vision
- Image Analysis


================================================================================
TASK: Evaluate this paper ABSTRACT for inclusion.
(This paper passed title screening)
================================================================================

TITLE: Mobile Based Automated Keratoconus Classification Via Transfer Learning
ABSTRACT: Keratoconus, a prevalent corneal ectatic disorder, poses significant challenges in its diagnosis and management. Traditionally relying on diagnostic methods like corneal topography, it is essential to explore more accurate and accessible approaches. Thus, in this work, aiming to classify Keratoconus eye disease using transfer learning via anterior segment photographed images (ASPI). ASPI was recorded and extracted into series of images using a smart phone from the lateral view of the eye. The experiment was conducted a thorough analysis to pinpoint the optimal configuration for image classification, addressing efficiency, accuracy, and practicality. Our study demonstrates the significance of optimizer selection and learning rate in transfer learning model development for Keratoconus classification. Specifically, the Adam optimizer, configured with a learning rate of 0.001, showcased outstanding performance with an accuracy of 98.21\%, precision of 100.00\%, and recall of 98.24\%. These results underscore the capacity to improve diagnostic instruments. This paper serves as a valuable resource for the eye imaging and deep learning communities, providing optimal strategies for precise Keratoconus classification and offering insights for the development of more dependable diagnostic tools.

================================================================================
SELECTION RULES (BE INCLUSIVE - DO NOT MISS RELEVANT PAPERS):
================================================================================

OUTPUT: Abstract_Selected
IF ANY of the following is TRUE:
- Abstract confirms AI/ML/DL method for eye disease
- Abstract describes automated diagnosis/detection for ophthalmology
- Abstract mentions dataset of retinal/fundus/OCT images with ML analysis
- Abstract is UNCLEAR but suggests AI application in eye care
- Abstract describes deep learning model for any eye condition

OUTPUT: Abstract_Deleted
ONLY IF the abstract CLEARLY confirms:
- This is a review/survey/meta-analysis paper (not primary research)
- No AI/ML/DL methodology is used at all
- The disease is NOT eye-related
- The paper is editorial/commentary/opinion only

================================================================================
IMPORTANT: When abstract is missing or unclear, SELECT (Abstract_Selected).
We prefer false positives over missing relevant papers.
================================================================================

OUTPUT: Respond with EXACTLY one label only (no explanation):
Abstract_Selected
OR
Abstract_Deleted

YOUR RESPONSE:
